Text: Lady Alpha, how did Master Shadow seem to you?

Beta nervously questions Lady Alpha, who has just
returned to the Shadow Garden hideout from the
royal capital.

Although you said he'd gotten into trouble, I found
him as normal.

So normal, in fact, that he devoured an extra-thick
Tuna King sandwich in a heartbeat.
With these words, Beta heaves a sigh of relief.

Thank goodness... So he has been released by the
Dark Knights.

Only due to insufficient evidence. They've not
cleared him as a suspect.
What...!? He's still under suspicion?

It's an outrage that they accused Master Shadow of
abduction in the first place!

There's nothing in this world that Master Shadow
can't obtain, so anyone would know that he doesn't
need to resort to abduction, or other such despicable
means.
That's because both you and I know Master Shadow well.

The faction within the Order of Dark Knights which
supports the Cult of Diablos want to paint him as the
culprit, whatever it takes. They don't care about the
real perpetrator.

They originally accused him as Cid Kagenou, an
unremarkable student from a poor, noble family.
It's unlikely they know who he really is.

Heehee... I bet they'll regret moving against him the
moment that they do.

Do you think Shadow will seek revenge? He doesn't
seem interested.

Typical Master Shadow! Small fry, like the Dark
Knights, aren't even on his mind! How benevolent.

Still, if he makes a serious effort...actually, even
without making a serious effort, he could sweep
the Dark Knights away. Why hasn't Master
Shadow put up a fight?

That's one thing I can't understand. So when I
learned he'd been captured by the Dark Knights,
I worried about whether to try and rescue him.

You made the right decision to contact me first,
rather than acting by yourself.

We shouldn't be crossing swords with the Order of
Dark Knights. They are not our real enemy.

Yes. I very nearly messed up Master Shadow's grand
plan when I failed to see that.

Now I understand. Everything from that moment he
confessed to Princess Alexia ties in together.

The confession to Princess Alexia was because Master
Shadow sensed she was being targeted by the Cult. It
was vital to guard her more closely.
That's what I thought at first.

Except Master Shadow couldn't prevent the abduction,
despite being with her. It's unthinkable, but did he
make a mistake?

Mind you, his plan can't be that simple! Master
Shadow is not one to make mistakes!

You're right. The abduction is only the prelude to a
grander plan.

When he let Princess Alexia get abducted, he took the
risk of being detained as a suspect by the Order of
Dark Knights.

Which  would trigger a move by the Fenrir sect of the
Cult of Diablos lurking within the capital and inside the
Order of Dark Knights. Thereby crushing them in one
fell swoop.

This is the full extent of Master Shadow's plan.
Don't you think?

Yes. Despite investigating, it wasn't easy to get a
complete picture of the Fenrir sect in the capital.
Then, we located their base and the opportunity
clearly presented itself.

Like a giant fish concealed in the deep
taking the bait... Is that what you mean?

Except that it's easy to say, but not so easy to
make the plan a reality.

In fact, his mind is so thorough that we couldn't
work out the whole plan through to its final stages.

Yet I wouldn't be surprised if Master Shadow pulls it
off by himself with no trouble at all.

Absolutely... If only he would trust us a little more
and consult with us beforehand.

If he had, you wouldn't have sent word in such a
panic from the capital.

Er, w-was I really panicking that much?!  I guess
you're right, maybe I was a little flustered.

Well, we've no time to sit back and relax, if we want
Shadow's plan to succeed. Beta, have you secured
enough personnel?

Y-Yes! Arrangements are in place for all active
Shadow Garden members to assemble in the capital.

114 personnel in total. The Seven Shadows are also
readying for the start of operations. This should be
sufficient power for simultaneous attacks on the
enemy hideouts.

On that note, you should contact Master Shadow in the
capital.
Why...me?

You want to tell him directly yourself, don't you?
I can see it written on your face.
Yes...! I'll depart immediately.

Wait, there's something else. I want you to search
for traces of Princess Alexia's magic and locate her
as well as organize the attack. Will you do it?
What's your response?

Er, umm... Haha..ha... Understood, leave Princess
Alexia to me!

(I'd only just managed to forget about the princess's
existence...)

(Mind you, I bet she will be fine even if I can't
locate her. She looks more stubborn than a
cockroach!)

With departure to the capital imminent, I am in high
spirits.

(I'll report about operations directly to my beloved
Master Shadow. It's such an honor. I can't wait to
see him!)

(But don't get carried away before the important plan
is executed, Beta! You need to restore the gravity of
the situation.)

Well, I'm going to be busy. First I must go to the
capital to tell Master Shadow about the Shadow
Garden's plan of action!
But... I am glad it is all Master Shadow's plan.

He can't be serious about dating that girl...Princess
Alexia. They've got absolutely nothing in common.

How stupid of me to doubt Master Shadow and believe
that they were dating... What an utter fool I've been!

Master Shadow would never forget his noble cause of
battling against the Cult of Diablos for flirtatious fun
and games.

He just used her as part of a meticulously prepared
and elaborately crafted plan... Heehee.

A smile spreads over Beta's face and turns into an
uncharacteristically wicked expression.

Though she may act like a princess, her only value
is as bait for Master Shadow to lure the Cult.

When the operation is over, I'll take that conceited
girl down a peg or two and show her how little she's
really worth!

As Beta skips away with a beaming smile Epsilon
approaches, having just finished preparing for the
assault.
Ah, Epsilon. Today should be a good day.
The sudden comment has Epsilon confused.

That's a flippant thing to say when we're about to
launch an attack.

I mean, what's got into you? You're acting like
it's a day trip...
Oh, sorry. I don't have time to talk right now.
Hold on!

I'm sorry. I have to leave right now to inform Master
Shadow of our plans.
Huh... Well, you better get going then.
Heehee!

What's gotten into her? Skipping when we're preparing
for battle!
